alert.note: Alert for Washington (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 3:13AM PST until January 30 at 7:31PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Benton and Polk Counties. Tualatin River at Farmington affecting Washington County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Pudding River at Aurora affecting Clackamas and Marion Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tualatin River at Farmington. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...Above 32.0 feet, expect flooding of numerous fields and low-lying farms, along with flooding of a few secondary roads in and around Farmington and Tualatin. Some farmland near the river channel will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM PST Monday the stage was 32.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 AM PST Monday was 32.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday evening and continue to fall. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 245 PM PST.
